newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks end up for 3rd day in row.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks end up for 3rd day in row.

text.p: Tokyo stocks ended higher for the third straight day on Wednesday, relieved by the U.S. Federal Reserve's decision to leave interest rates steady.
But brokers said the market lacked energy to test higher levels.
The key 225-share Nikkei average closed up 148.01 points or 0.70 percent at 21,275.02, off a high of 21,391.00 set earlier in the day. Its September futures gained 80 points to 21,260.
"One of the drags on the market has disappeared," said Haruo Nakaharu,a strategist at Toyo Securities Co Ltd. He was referring to Tuesday's Federal Open Market Committee meeting.
Gainers were led by iron/steel, fisheries, sea transport, banks and pharmaceuticals.
The key retreating sectors were warehouses, electric power, services and credit/lease.
Brokers said no individual issues led today's rally.
Blue-chip Fuji Photo Film Co Ltd gained 150 yen to close at 3,450.
Matsushita-Kotobuki Electronics Industries Ltd advanced 160 yen to end at 2,760, after the company raised its earnings forecast on Tuesday.
